title: Pasta with pesto peas with crispy Serrano ham
directions: Blanch the peas in boiling salted water for about 5 minutes , then drain and pass immediately under cold water to keep their bright green color.

Pour into the glass of the mixer, add the mint leaves and basil, a pinch of salt and blend until you have a smooth cream. If you want you can also add about 125 ml of extra virgin olive oil . Taste and put salt , if necessary.
While the pasta is cooking in boiling salted water, cut the ham in slices and cook them in a pan without adding fat, until it get crispy .
Drain the pasta , toss with the pesto peas, a trickle of olive oil ( if desired ) and add the Parmigiano Reggiano cheese. Garnish the dish
